cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. December 1942.Copy JNp.//WAR CABINET.NETHERLANDS GOVERNMENT' S VIEWS ON THE SITUATIONIN FRENCH NORTH AFRICA.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.I circulate to my colleagues herewith a copy of a note which I have receivedfrom the Netherlands Ambassador, containing the Netherlands Governments,views on the situation in French North Africa.A. E.ANNEX.Netherlands Ambassador to Mr. Eden.(No. 4159.)Your Excellency, London, December 9, 1942.WITH reference to our conversation of the day before yesterday, I have been instructed to express the concern of the Netherlands Cabinet at trie present"position of Admiral Darlan in North Africa. It is felt that a dishearteningimpression has been created amongst an important part of the Netherlands nation,who will be unable to understand that use' is being made, be it for an immediatemilitary advantage, of the services of a man who for some considerable time hasbeen one of the chief exponents of collaboration with Germany.The Netherlands Ambassador in Washington has been instructed to makea similar communication.I have the honour to remain,with the highest consideration,Your Excellency's obedient Servant,E. MICHIELS VAN VERDUYNEN.SECRET.W.P. (42) 576.December 11, 1942.11923 [24749]
